description: I have a single large Lime tree in the Rear Garden of my property, 37 Cromwell Grove, and I am seeking approval to pollard this tree back to its originalpollarding points. The tree requires pollarding every 3-4 years for two reasons: first, the health of the tree itself; and second, because the tree blocks outsunlight to neighbouring gardens to an extent that is unreasonable and disruptive. I have owned the property since 2007, and have used professionaltree surgeons to pollard this tree regularly (with appropriate permissions) and it is now due to be pollarded in advance of next summer's growth. I am submitting as part of this application a sketch showing the position of the tree, its foliage and the negative impact on sunlight toneighbouring gardens. I have used this same sketch in successful applications for pollarding in the past.
borough: London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
